item.title: CIO industry insight podcast #11: Brad Howarth talks about the future of broadband
item.description: Journalist for CIO Australia, Lisa Banks, chats to Brad Howarth about A Faster Future; the book he co-authored with Janelle Ledwidge.

item.title: CIO Live Podcast #89: Graham Waller, vice president and executive partner, Gartner
item.description: CIO Australia editor, Georgina Swan, talks with Graham Waller, co-author of The CIO Edge - 7 Leadership Skills you need to drive results. The book examines the key skills CIOs need and how to develop them,focusing on the importance of the interplay between IT processes and people leadership.

item.title: CIO industry insight podcast #10: Rob Livingstone discusses the instruments required to fly into the cloud
item.description: CIO Australia editor, Georgina Swan, talks to the 'accidental CIO' about the opportunities and pitfalls of the cloud

item.title: CIO Industry Insight Podcast #9: Tim Ayling, Chief Executive Officer, Platform46
item.description: CIO Australia editor, Georgina Swan, talks with Platform46 CEO, Tim Ayling, about collaboration in the enterprise.

item.title: Special Report: Green and Sustainable IT in the Enterprise
item.description: Despite all the hype surrounding Green IT, many CIOs and senior IT executives are unsure about the best way to start their organisations on the green journey. In this special edition podcast, CIO Australia editor Matt Rodgers speaks to Sundeep Khisty, Green Practice Leader, HP Enterprise Services, Asia Pacific & Japan, about how CIOs can best guide IT to become a core part of a company's sustainability strategy.

item.title: CIO Industry Insight Podcast #9 Scott Dawes, VP of Applications Business Unit, Oracle ANZ
item.description: CIO Australia Editor Matt Rodgers catches up with Scott Dawes, VP of Oracle's Applications Business Unit in A/NZ, about the role supply chain and logistics software plays in keeping global businesses moving.
